info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 07 at 7:55PM EDT until September 07 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Alexander County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Caldwell County in western North Carolina... East central Burke County in western North Carolina... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 755 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Rhodhiss, or 7 miles west of Hickory, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Sawmills, Granite Falls, Valdese, Bethlehem, Hudson, Icard, Connelly Springs, Rutherford College, Rhodhiss, Lake Rhodhiss, Lake Hickory, and Northlakes. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
